result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle M Petrie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Klein.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Danielle M Petrie in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Klein makes statements regarding sentencing. Atty Klein requests expungement. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant is sentenced to the following.

COUNT#1: 

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 MONTHS HUBER (CREDIT - 0 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR	***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia. 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  

COSTS:  $268.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 15 days, straight time, STAYED for use of agent with court permission.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant Danielle M Petrie in court with Attorney Jessica A Klein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Danielle M Petrie in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recess at 10:09.  Case recalled at 10:15 with same appearances.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Atty Jessica Klein has been appointed (PD rate). Defendant to pay: $50/month.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Danielle M Petrie in court.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicates she is not eligible for the Public Defender.  Defendant is requesting the court appoint counsel.  Court grants the request.  Defendant to reimburse the county at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 1/4/16 and the 4th of each month, thereafter.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Danielle M Petrie in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
